meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characterized by perfectionism.
meanings.sent1: Her perfectionistic nature made her strive for flawlessness in everything she did.
meanings.sent2: The perfectionistic artist spent hours perfecting every detail of his masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The perfectionistic chef refused to serve the dish until it met her exacting standards.
meanings.sent4: His perfectionistic approach to problem-solving ensured that every solution was meticulously crafted.
meanings.sent5: The perfectionistic gardener meticulously tended to each plant, ensuring they thrived in ideal conditions.

meanings.definition: Having or showing a tendency to set excessively high standards for oneself or others.
meanings.sent1: She was so perfectionistic that even a small mistake would bother her for days.
meanings.sent2: His perfectionistic attitude often led to feelings of frustration when things didn't go as planned.
meanings.sent3: The perfectionistic student was disappointed with a 98% on the exam, feeling it wasn't good enough.
meanings.sent4: Her perfectionistic tendencies sometimes caused her to overlook the efforts of others.
meanings.sent5: The perfectionistic coach pushed his team to their limits, always expecting nothing but the best from them.
